intro: Scabiosa spreta, commonly known as the pink pincushion flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dense, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in fine hairs. Scabiosa spreta is a hardy perennial that is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
